Human aging is when people grow older over time. This happens to everyone. As we age, our bodies change. We might have more aches and pains, and we might not be able to do things as quickly as before. Our minds can also change, and we might have trouble remembering things. These changes happen slowly, over many years. Doctors and scientists are still learning about why and how this happens.

Human aging is a natural process where our bodies change over time. It starts from birth, but we notice it more as we grow older. Our cells divide and reproduce, but with age, they don't work as well. This leads to wrinkles, gray hair, and slower movements. Our organs also age, making us more prone to diseases like heart disease or Alzheimer's. Aging is a complex process influenced by both our genes and our lifestyle. While we can't stop it, we can slow it down by eating healthily, exercising, and avoiding harmful habits like smoking.
